review text:
If you like hot coffee, this is the unit for you. I am astounded how hot a cup of coffee this thing makes. I usually enjoy a splash of creamer in my coffee and even after pouring cold creamer in my cup, the coffee is still quite hot.

This unit has settings for 6, 8 or 10oz brews. I find that I don't get quite that full amount in my cup. This could be caused by the retention of liquid in the k-cup itself. However, I do get a consistent amount of coffee for each brew volume selected. I enjoy getting a 14oz cup of coffee from my darker roast k-cups. The nice thing about this unit is that I can select an 8oz cup and let it brew. Then once complete I can cycle the power and then select a 6oz brew to get my 14oz cup. What is nice is that I don't have to lift the lid on the k-cup itself between the two brew cycles.

The 50oz reservoir is easy to fill. I like that I don't have to remove the tank from the unit to fill it. Simply removing the lid allows for the tank to be easily filled. I am using distilled water in my unit because my water is moderately hard. Harder water can destroy the boiler and supply lines in devices like this very quickly. So, if your water is even somewhat hard, I would suggest using distilled or bottled drinking water to ensure the longevity of your unit. The coffee maker almost immediately starts dispensing coffee once you hit the brew button. Then entire brew time takes about 1 to 2 minutes depending on the brew volume selected.

One thing to be aware of with this unit is that there is a size limitation to the cup that can be used. Tall travel mugs will not fit under this unit at all. You will have to brew into a standard size cup and transfer it to your travel mug. Additionally, if you have large diameter cups, they might not fit under the unit very well. I have some pretty large diameter cups, but only the largest of the large wouldn't fit under the unit.

Because this unit makes such a hot cup of coffee, it billows out a large amount of steam when brewing. This steam travels up the control panel and condenses a bit. I was initially worried that this steam condensation might cause problems with the control panel. However, after two months, I haven't had any issues.

Besides k-cups, you can also brew your own ground coffee in the included k-cup adapter. This is a nice feature and works quite well. The only drawback to using the k-cup adapter is cleaning it out. Even after dumping most of the grounds in the trash, you are going to have to rinse some grounds down the drain cleaning the adapter out.

Overall, I am very pleased with my purchase of the Mecity Coffee Maker. I think if you are looking to get a k-cup compatible machine, you should give the Mecity some serious consideration.

Nice looking coffee maker. Heavy built. Makes a good cup of coffee. I ordered it and was in 2 days later. Arrived on the 6th of February 23'. Used until the 14th of March. A touch over a month and it has quit. It will spit out a couple ounces of coffee then stop perculating. Tried to return for replacement or refund but they won't accept it back. Roll the dice at your own risk. You may get one that's not a lemon but I got a lemon and it won't make lemonade or coffee. Update after a couple days of review. Further studies determine I wasn't actually contacting seller. It was some auto response. The seller has since then reached out to me and has made this right. Whether the product is good is still to be determined but the customer service is excellent. Prompt, concerned about the issue and wants to correct it by sending me a new pot free of charge no shipping. I guess the seller will make you lemonade since the coffee maker didn't ;)

I have been loving this since I bought it Oct 2022.
However this morning it started leaking. I started to use my coffee maker this morning. I filled the tank, added the grounds. It initially sounded like it was grinding beans. I hit the 10oz setting barely 4 oz came out. I tried it again. That is when it started to leak. not from the tank and not where the coffee comes out.
It was leaking from under the machine. Thought I should descale it. Well, it leaks while the descaling is going on.

I got this K-cup brewer because I have a bunch of K-cups after my fancy-schmancy Keurig machine died.
Pros:
- it’s fast.
- compact footprint
- comes with extra inserts for tea & coffee that others sell extra
- it makes 3 sizes of brew from 200 ml to 300 ml
- it’s cheap, but has good fit & finish
- can be descaled with vinegar (if you have hard water)

Cons:
- some parts are not dishwasher safe
- no temperature settings (for us snobs that like superhot water for brewing)
- water tank looks like it’s styrene, so DONT drop it!
- it’s made in China, so wash the <censored> outta it before use.

So far I am happy with it.

Did I say it brews fast?

UPDATE: 6 Mar 22- still going strong, did a pre-emptive descale (SWMBO tossed the box 📦 with the instructions) so I just ran a tank of water with a cup of vinegar through the unit and another tank of rinse water (tip- save the vinegar mix and add it to your dishwasher’s rinse cycle) … I suggest you descale the machine every couple of months —don’t wait for the flashing lights — if your dishwasher gets that calcium scale buildup it’s a sign your waters hard (high mineral content) and the same thing is happening inside your coffee machine.

It still brews fast…

I received this single cup coffee maker about a month ago. Let me say, after using it every day since then, that it is just perfect for a single person. I make 2 cups of coffee every day, at least. I usually use the largest cup setting, which is 12 oz! I have read reviews that they don't have a cup that fits into the space it should go. That is a little bit different than a Kurig. It's not true that a regular sized coffe cup doesn't fit there. However, a thermos type cup will not work. This taller cup I have is the only one that works on the largest cup setting. The medium cup setting dispenses about 9 oz. The smallest cup setting dispenses a little more than 7 oz. The coffee is hot at 168 degrees. It comes with a holder for single kurig type pods but it also takes pods which have an indentation in the middle of the bottom if the pods. The piercing needle is on the side instead if the middle. It comes with a super holder for tea leaves and 2 holders for you own ground coffee. I found the coffee was not strong enough for my liking using my own grounds, even dark roast. Perhaps I'd like that feature using ground coffee in the tea leaf holder as it's mych deeper. Anyway, I am loving it. If you're a single person like me, I found trying to make a pot of coffee with just enough so I didn't waste it AND it didn't taste burnt by the time I was ready for my second cup just a total pain in the a**. This works!

I am surprised by how much I like this brewer. It makes a good cup of coffee very quickly and the water tank holds a decent amount while using such a small footprint. My only complaint is that there doesn’t seem to be a way to purchase additional filters to use with grounds as filters from our other brewers aren’t compatible. Overall, this seems to be a good little machine.

review name: WARNING: May cause taste buds to fall off
review text: Listen up folks, I've been through some tough stuff in my life, but this Mecity Coffee Maker put me to the test. Let me tell you, it makes a damn good cup of coffee with those K-cups, but when it comes to using ground coffee, it's like trying to drink battery acid. It's like they put a warning label on it, "WARNING: May cause taste buds to fall off." But, that's not to say it's a complete failure. It's a 3-in-1 machine, it's like having a swiss army knife of coffee makers. You can make a K-cup coffee, loose tea, and even ground coffee. But if you're gonna use ground coffee, I suggest you bring a damn fire extinguisher, because it's gonna be hot and bitter. But overall, It's not a complete disaster, it's like trying to run a marathon in flip flops, it's not ideal but you can still finish it. I'll give it 4 stars, but use it with caution. D. Goggins

review name: Almost as fast makes great coffee
review text:
I've had many K cup makers some over 200 bucks they all quit working after one to two years , I found awhile back that some of the cheaper K cup makers hold up better and a much lower price tag, some as low as 30 bucks, but they all take a good 3 minutes to make one cup of coffee and you have fill the coffeemaker for each cup.
The Mecity makes your coffee in a minute or a little less, also you select from 3 different cup sizes and has a good size reservoir .
I bought this Mecity on sale for around 60 bucks including tax so far so good makes my cup fast and hot as with almost all K cup makers you can't fit a travel cup even by removing the drip tray, I hope it keeps working for more then 2 years that would be a real win for me that's the longest any K cup makers has lasted for me.
I like this little coffee maker. It’s very easy to use plus it can make hot tea.

I am so glad that I bought this coffee maker it is just what we needed we've had Keurigs before and this is actually better. The coffee is hot the settings are easy you can just tap on the cup size and you tap it again and it stops. It's great!
It is smallest than I was expecting and you cannot put a tall coffee cup in it. Otherwise very happy with this product.
Really like this. And it came with pods for k-cups and for regular coffee and tea. It is compact and doesn't take up alot of counter space

I have coffee very quickly and it's hot.
A little loud with the pump, but I am only for coffee when I get up.
Heavily made, with small footprint and a large reservoir. 12-6 oz cups

No bells or whistles just a great little coffee machine. Got tired of descaling issues with the keurig machine's. Water reservoir is small but we keep a pitcher of distilled water in the fridge. That has illuminated the need to descale every few months.
The wife loves it !!!
This is the best purchased item I have ever bought in my life. I love it! Fast, convenient and just the right size . Easy to use. I 100% recommend 👌

Got this for work, it’s simple clean design would work in any kitchen, especially small ones. Compact sleek comes with adapters for
K cup, tea , or self ground coffee. Several coworkers have bought this for it’s simple design, and concept after using it.

I have only tried coffee pods and tea bags in the week that I have had my machine. The Tea bags work better in the microwave! The pods work great but the coffee is kinda weak. Still working on it. Will update if I come up with more information.

I had a Keurig 2.0 that required using only their brand of copyrighted coffee. PIA.
This comes with inserts for the K Cup, and a two fill your coffee inserts.
Simple to operate. Power button to warm it up and choice of water mix sizes. Viola. Coffee

We started using this coffeemaker about a week ago. Our main goal was to save money and reduce the number of k-cups we were sending to the landfill. We love that there are three different filters (pods, ground coffee or tea), giving us lots of flexibility.

Some pros so far:
** The unit is fairly compact and attractive
** Easy to operate
** Coffee is hotter than our old keurig

Some cons:
** So far we have found the coffee brewed from grounds to be weak
** The ground coffee filter is too small to add more coffee (holds 2 TbS)
** If you want a stronger cup of coffee, you’ll need to choose the 6 oz. Size

I contacted the manufacturer for tips on how to brew a stronger cup of coffee. They did reply quickly and said we should use a coarse ground, don’t tamp down the grounds and brew 6 ounces.

We are still experimenting to get a stronger cup of coffee. Will try coarsely grinding our own beans or switching to another brand of ground coffee. Will come back and update my review if we succeed.

Love this coffee maker. We found ourselves replacing Keurig about every year and a half. This coffee maker is robust, makes great coffee and comparable to Keurig if not better.
Love the sleek compact size.
Highly recommend
I read reviews, liked what I read, and I am not disappointed.
I like that you can use it for K cups, tea, and regular coffee, all brands.
Liked

For the price I wasn’t sure what to expect but it is a great coffee pot! I have always had Keurig coffee pots which are expensive so I decided to try this one which works for K cups, loose coffee, and loose tea. Very happy I gave it a try:)
Happy with it.

review name: Update:it's fantastic Original: Stopped working correctly after two weeks
review text:
It worked wonderfully for about two and a half weeks, and suddenly it makes maybe 2oz of coffee when I select the large size. It sounds like it's struggling to even do that. I'm very disappointed. Amazon is replacing it, if replacement works as it should, for more than two weeks, I will update my review. Photo attached shows how much came out when I selected large.

Update: The company replaced my defective item without me even having to return the defective item. The new one has worked perfectly for me and I enjoy it every day! Back up to 5 stars. The company was very helpful and accommodating!
Easy to use. Makes an amazing cup of coffee. Different size cups can be made. Fast and efficient.

Update: I've changed my rating from 2 to 3 stars because, while I am still returning this item because it doesn't fit the various standard sized cups that I have, the seller has reached out to attempt to provide a solution. I appreciate that the seller is conscientious and attempting to provide good customer service. For reference, I've attached a picture of the coffee cups that I attempted to use. Two of them are standard, 7" yeti travel mugs. The other 3 are random ceramic coffee cups from various retailers that we use most often. I also attached photos of the generic coffee cup that I received with our previous Keurig contrasted against my favorite ceramic mug. If you use a cup similar to the plain white one, this may be a great coffee maker for you. If your mugs are a little fatter, such as the blue cup in the photo, they won't fit.

I was excited to find this as a replacement for a Keurig, until I attempted to put a normal sized travel mug on it. It is a full 1/2" too short. Then I tried my favorite coffee mug - nope, it's too fat for the narrow opening. Will be returning this immediately. It's a decent looking machine but is useless if you can't use anything except a skinny, short coffee mug.
Easy to use, slim design and looks beautiful on our coffee counter.
Mecity has great customer service. They took care of my problem quickly and efficiently. Thanks.

review name: Unbelievable little machine for my coffee, which is always hot COVID-19 endi
review text: I am not good with too many buttons, but this machine is perfectly illustrated in the book and I love it. I’d like to buy my daughter-in-law one if she needed it.

I like that you can do pods and ground coffee. Good price. the only thing I would change is the scoop they give you. I keep my scoop in my coffee container and when you try to find a brown scoop in a container of coffee its hard. I would like to have a neon color so I could see it without digging around in my coffee grounds..

Make a good cup of coffee but poor design of cup area.
Very narrow so any "mug" type of cup won't fit properly.
Love this coffee pot for the money. Heats up fast and works great, only thing I would like to see done better is it is hard to remove the pod from the machine.
The place where you put your coffee cup is too small. Only a small mug will fit.

Yes to this simple easy to set up and use Coffee Maker. It makes "HOT" coffee, comes with three extra coffee filters for other beverages ie...ground coffee, tea and hot cocoa etc. I'll keep this review short and sweet to match the simplistic genius of this machine. I've had three of the "famous K" that chocked within a year and each were way over a hundred dollars. NO MORE...I've had the best cup of hot coffee in years. Get this you won't be sorry. The Price...awesome. The Taste...Yummy...The foot print...delightful. It fits under your cabinets. Enjoy,

This k cup coffee maker is different from the 2 other units I purchased from Amazon. First It looks more stylish has an easy to use touch pad and is smaller in terms of height than most others. The water reservoir is decent, I can brew 3 large cups without refilling. The cover for the tank feels solid and not as flimsy as on my other machines. But what I have really noticed is that the motor is different from all others. It is much quieter and quicker and the water is hotter and comes out instantly. On all my other machines you press the button, it blinks, rattles, clicks, and after a while a little stream of coffee comes out. It's a little more than a wanted to spend on yet another machine but if this one lasts it will be one thing less to worry about.
My grandma loves it she used her Folgers k-cups and it was hot and dark like she liked it. Update: nope she doesn’t like it anymore lasted a month before it would take more times to fill up a cup.

I bought this after the much more expensive popular brand one went out. And it has been amazing. The coffee is the correct temperature and it comes out fast and perfect. My staff loves it and so do I. I’m thinking about getting one for my house.
Love this coffee maker the coffee is hot the coffee maker is fast

review name: Coffee tastes great. Fast and good.

review text:

Although I only just received this today, I am super pleased with it. So easy to use, very fast, and serves up a HOT cup of coffee. It does not have a clock, so you cannot set it up to have your coffee ready at a certain time, but really, it is so fast that you don't really need that.

Great small coffee pot. It has 3 pods. One for c cup pods, one for lose tea and one for ground coffee. The water tank holds enough water for 5 cups of coffee.
Makes great coffee.

Ive had 3 different keurigs and they have had the reusable coffee pods that you could use regular coffee grinds with. They always leaked and got grinds into my cup of coffee, but this one came with 2 reusable coffee pods and neither of them leak!!!

Great choice for a quick and easy to use frothier and can save money using less creamer or milk. Added it to be used with the Mecity Coffee Maker 3-in-1 Single Serve Coffee Machine and family loves them both. No more need to spend extra money on commercial coffee shops.

review name: HOW OFTEN SHOULD I UNPLUG? AFTER FIRST USE, ONE DAY'S USE, ONE WEEKS USE ETC.!!!
review text: I CHANGED FROM KURIG WHEN IT CRASHED ON ME AND NO ONE COULD TELL ME WHY. YOU TELL ME TO UNPLG THE MACHINE WHEN NOT IN USE BUT WITH NO INSTRUCTIONS ON WHEN. I USE MY MACHINE LESS THAN ONCE A DAY. SO??? I COULD NOT GET IN TOUCH WITH YOU TO ANSWER MY QUESTION, THRU AMAZON OR YOU.

This was such a great present for my husband. He gets up so early for work and I swear his cup of coffee is ready in less than a minute. We have small counter space so it fits in the corner perfectly and yeah great purchase, pretty cost effective as well. Highly reccomend

review text: Easy to use and the removable water tank makes refilling a simple task. I've only used it for k-cups and ground coffee; I haven't tried it for loose tea.
Great Value

In my life time, so when I tell you that for me this machine not only handles the coffee making stress that I put it thru and did not matter between pods or grounds it still preformed excellently. Now I drink coffee, no fufu crap. Straight unadulterated coffee, I drink dark roast with a splash of cream. Don't over look this machine for something you think is better.

The coffee maker worked fine when I got it and I love the baskets for ground coffee and loose tea. However, It only lasted 3 months being used 1-2 times daily in the office. I wish I had spent the extra money on the name brand because now I can spend another $60 on this junk or the original amount I would have spent had I not wasted my money on this first. Very annoyed.
Good coffee pot, if you want better your going have to spend an extra $50.00,

This works faster than my keurig I had, and the little tank on the back holds enough for 3-4 cups!! If you’re looking for one this is the one to get!

review name: Easy use and worth the money
review text: For years I have used another brand of brewer. Due to some problems, I decided to change brands. I spent hours reading about various brewers. Always going back to the Mecity 3 in 1 brewer. I like the ability of being able to have pods, loose tea and powder coffee in one brewer The large water container makes it easy to make coffee with out having to refill the reservoir every time. Thanks for a great brewe
The best coffee maker I have ever bought. Coffee ready in seconds love it

I have gone thru 4 name brand coffee makers, so I thought I world try something different. I love it! I haven’t had any exploding pods, It makes coffee fast. The only thing that is different is that it doesn’t warm if it’s low on water, it will just stop. I personally don’t have a problem with this, especially for the price difference. I am very happy with this coffee maker and trust me, It gets A LOT of use!!! I highly recommend this one!!!!

The only downside for me is even when removing the bottom tray to make room for taller cups/mugs my 20 oz tumbler is still too tall. This may be an inexpensive coffee maker but don’t be fooled. It makes the hottest coffee in the fastest time ever. I purchased this to fill in for my expensive coffee maker while I waited for the replacement and when it camE I have continued using my little replacement. It is the fastest and hottest coffee I have ever gotten from any coffeemaker. HIGHLY RECOMMEND.

It brewed only a tablespoon spoon of coffee. The next day the machine leaked water all on to my counter. The entire back reservoir had emptied. I did not see anything broken.

review name: Very fast brewing, easy operation, no college degree required
review text:
This is a nice coffee maker, reasonably priced and it brews in about a minute. Three cup size settings. A light touch of the power and cup size selection buttons, and in about a minute, you have a nice cup of coffee. I prefer K Cup, but there are also two more options (slip in adapters) for grounds or tea.

There is also a detachable water reservoir.
I absolutely love this coffee pot. I'm going to order more for each house
Coffee and tea

review name: I love the petite dimensions of this coffee maker!
review text: Very easy to use, provides options for tea. . Doesn’t take up a lot of counter top, which is high-priced real estate in most homes. It has a reservoir, which is a great feature. I’ve had 3 keurigs that cost a lot of money and didn’t last long, and customer service never got back to me on any of them. So this is an experiment, and so far a success. We shall see.
Such a great coffee maker way better than a Keurig. I'm glad I bought it and use it often with K-cups and coffee grounds.
Product works well and seems well built. Noisy operation. Biggest surprise was the size - much smaller than the photos depict. Not happy about that for this price.
Do not buy if you like strong coffee.

So far, three times used, the coffee maker is really nice. I love not having to refill for each cup. No pods have exploded in it. The only thing I would change is the cup sizes. No use for 6 ounces. I would do 8,10,12 . Your coffee is made quickly. So far, I really like it and see no reason why that would change. It surpasses my other coffee makers for sure. Very happy with the product!
It looks good in the break room at my work. It's easy to use and clean.

Should have lasted longer than 15 months.
Product should not be sold.
Never buy again.

A very simple coffee maker. For a single serving maker. Holds enough water for about
5 cups. A real deal
I have not used all the features yet. I do wish it had a temp setting. Not a big deal but useful. Easy to use. Small and compact on the counter. And stylish. I like it very much.

I have had at least a half dozen Keurig machines and a few other brands. None of them do what this machine does...make a fast cup of coffee. With my other machines I would start a cup and walk away waiting for it to heat up and brew. Not with this one, it brews almost as soon as you press the button. No time to walk away.

review name: Not good for heavy coffee drinkers
review text: Needs descaling every 2 weeks or you only get 1 oz of coffee..never had a pot do this before.
Compared with my original coffee machine, it is easy to use, a\saves time and saves coffee powder.

It worked great for about 10 months, then it got slower and slower making coffee til it finally died. Bought another one, no problems. Makes coffee in less than 3 mins. When this one dies, I'll buy another one.
coffee pot is not working after 3 months, back to my old one; now just to let you know it start to smoke and no water was coming out.

My husband and I aren't heavy coffee drinkers, but used this coffee maker once daily. We purchased it in July 2022 and already have had 2 problems with it. This last problem is causing us to have to purchase a different coffee maker. Our first problem was because we were only getting about a quarter of a cup of coffee, so we cleaned the maker according to the manufacturer. It worked well perhaps another month. Now the electronics of it seem to be malfunctioning. Instead of 3 choices for cup sizes, it will only give us the medium. The return window expired, so I guess we're stuck. Save your money. :(
Much smaller than I thought, was hoping for 10 Oz cup of coffee. Love that one has the option of using pods or ground coffee. Probably wouldn't buy this again.

I had this for a little over a month before writing my review.

Initially I loved this machine. I only drink one or two cups of coffee each day so this made more sense than a typical pot. I also prefer not to use K-cups so this machine gave me the option of using the coffee I prefer…win win, right? Wrong.

After a month of use my coffee began to taste like nothing. Literally, hot water. I followed their instructions and descaled the machine. It didn’t help. Since I’m out of the return window I’m stuck with an overpriced single cup water heater.

I’m going back to using my Mr. Coffee.

review name: NO customer service for replacement parts !!- beware !!
review text:
was intally great then water tank got broken and i tried to find a way to replace it high and low, the amazon site offers no replacement parts of anything and mecity is a website that sends you back to the amazon store site, also customer service is only accessible via email and ive tried 3xs and keeps coming back invalid email address.
very disappointed, i notice like 4 different companies in china sell the same item with different names and none offer replacement parts, shame that a piece breaks and you have to just buy the whole new unit 79 dollars with 20 dollar coupon still is wasting a machine for a water tank replacement.
SO i guess if something breaks there motto is tough, buy another whole machine, someone into climate change might want to say something since we now have to manufacture and buy a whole other item and this one goes in the trash seems very wasteful. perhaps keurig is the better brand alittle more expensive but at least they have parts.

review name: It's fast and easy to use.
review text: I like everything about the coffee maker, the only thing I would change is a maybe a bigger water reservoir, but frankly it does hold enough to brew 4 standard cups at a time and that is convenient enough for The price, which is a great value. I'm happy with it so far.

This coffee maker is really top quality! I've never heard of the brand before this but this machine has made me a fan. I can see the durable and functional construction of this machine. I also have a Keurig and this machine definitely competes with the quality and function of the Keurig.
It comes with extra accessories like reusable cups for ground coffee and even tea. The reservoir is large so there's no need to keep filling for extra cups of coffee. It heats up quick and drips smoothly. I am a fan of Mecity now and will definitely recommend this coffee machine to anyone!

I love this! This machine is more expensive than many others but I think what makes this k cup machine great makes it worth the price. It’s just about ready to use right out of the box. Just remove a few pieces of tape and the few external parts from the water reservoir and it’s ready to go. There is a cubby in the back for the cord which I love. I also love that there is a water reservoir. It comes ready for a k cup and there are also 2 separate cups; 1 for loose coffee grounds and the other for tea which are both labeled. Also included is a small coffee scoop with a brush on the end of the handle. I presume that the scoop fits the amount of grounds for a standard cup of coffee, so that’s nice. The buttons are few and simple. Power, full cuppa, half cuppa and barely a cuppa. Here’s the best part, this machine heats the water SO FAST! I pushed for a full cuppa and I swear it was done in a minute, maybe less. Also, the space for your cup is tall - not quite tall enough for a 20oz tumbler, but taller than a lot of the other k cup machines I’ve tried. The coffee comes out piping hot and tasty. Time will tell on its lifespan but fingers crossed it has a good long life of making my coffee.
Video Player is loading.

review name: Is it possible to prepare these pods on this machine?
Useful single-serve coffee maker, with reservations
review text:
This coffee maker works great with K-cups. Excellent cup of coffee. However, the reusable tea and coffee pods are lacking. We tried using the reusable coffee pod and the results were really bad. All the water was just going straight through the middle of the grounds with minimal dispersion. So, we tried the reusable pod labelled for tea and that actually let the water mix with the coffee grounds better... still not a great cup of coffee (a little weak, but far better than the pod labelled coffee). Not sure what's up with that, but if you try the coffee pod and only get vaguely brown water, try the pod labelled for tea.

So, for actual K-cup style single-use pods, this unit works great and heats to a good temperature. But, if you're looking to get a single use coffee maker with the ability to manually load a reusable pod and brew that way (i.e., to not add so much plastic to the landfill) ... I'd look elsewhere. There are far better units out there with that capability.

I have been using this several times a day for a nice little while. It is easy to use, attractive and works really well. So far using it just for K Cups but it has inserts for ground coffee and other options as well. It is small and compact but does as good a job as some bigger machines

review name: Minimal, multi-usage coffee maker with questionable quality and durability
review text:
This cute coffee maker allows you to use a K-cup, coffee of your choice, or tea. However, I still keep the box in case I have to return as I do not believe in the quality of the product. This coffee maker is compact and has a sleek design. However, the quality is below subpar (see pictures):
The coffee tray is silver-coated plastic, and it already shows scratches from simply putting coffee cups on and off. The water reservoir lid is loosely snapped to the water reservoir unit and is so thin that it makes it hard to grab to remove the lid to fill up the water. Unfortunately, I accidentally dropped the lid, and it now has a dent. The three filters that come with it are also of poor quality plastic. Looking at the pictures, you will see that the filter lids have some dents and scratches and are not entirely snapped to the filter body; and that is how they come right out of the box.

So, in summary, the coffee maker works (for now) and is affordable, but most of the parts are made of low-quality plastic with low-quality control, so one may question how long it will last and whether it is safe to use. Hence, a 3-star rating. Thanks for reading!
lasted 6 month,can notfind way toget service on warenty.

Good coffee maker. I love the 3-in-1 features, I have used it to make a K-cup coffee, and regular coffee brew (note that you don't need to buy an additional sieve/filter to use this machine). The machine comes with three permanent filters for different beverages and it also comes with a removable drip tray to accommodate your cup size. It takes less counter space. You have the option to choose your brewing cup size with a touch. So far, I love this coffee maker.

Update:
After 3 months of use, this coffee maker begins to malfunction. The smallest & biggest cup-size button refused to operate. The medium size cup button still works.

review text: I got this single cup coffee maker to replace my kureig that died on me and I'm really glad I did! This coffee maker looks sorta generic and isn't as sleek and beautiful as the kureig is but let me tell you, it works every bit as good if not better. It heats up the water faster than my old one did and it stays hotter longer in my coffee cup. It seems to even have a fresher taste too. It's basic but does exactly what it's meant to and it does it very well! I may never go back to the other brand again! I'm very impressed with it. This is also great for those grandparents that don't like complicated electronics but want to use the k-cups. Simple but amazing! Get one, you won't be sorry! Five stars all the way!

review name: Makes a great cup of joe and fast!

review text: Upon unpacking, found that box contained 2 loose tea adapters, 1 loose coffee adapter, and no K-cup adapter, making it worthless. Not worth going through the hassle - returning for refund.

I like how a K-Cup OR just coffee grounds can be put in the same part to brew coffee. I used to have a Keurig and the one I had required me to get a separate piece if I wanted to use coffee grounds by themselves. And as far as the water goes, I always found it easiest to do it like this: I would just put a little less than I would actually want, into the cup I would be using, and then dump that into the water reservoir. That way, that's exactly what will brew. It would depend on how you like your coffee though. I like a little coffee with my cream and sugar, which is why I put a little bit less water than I really need. So if you take yours just straight then don't put a little less than you would actually want. Just put as much water that you would actually want.

I've been using this coffee maker for a couple weeks with excellent results! We don't generally buy the K-cups themselves, but we prefer to buy whole bean coffee - grind it ourselves (per cup) and then use the reusable mesh K-cup included with the maker.
This maker has a slightly different mesh cup design (compared to most) - and the first time we ran just hot water through it - it smelled a big like melting plastic. However, that is not unusual for a new appliance - especially one that has a heating element. After that first time, no more smell - and it's been working great!
Quick cup of delicious coffee, easy to use! 5-stars!

This coffee maker is small and well made. (I have the stainless steel) I had never heard of the brand and it was an emergency replacement for our Keurig. While there are a couple things I miss that were relevant to the Keurig, this coffee maker is absolutely able to make a great cup of coffee! And, it comes out HOT! So much more than the Keurig we had (K-150 Supreme). The reservior holds about 8 cups of water and is easy to fill, either by adding water or detaching the reservoir and filling from the water tap. It has a beeping when the coffee is ready. It takes only a minute or so, and I am very satisfied with this purchase. I highly recommend it. The price was really affordable, too.

This is my first off brand purchased this to replace my Keurig coffee maker after it broke. I love that this machine beeps when out of water, pods are hard to get out, but holds a good amount of water, works well, and pleased overall.
The only thing I don't like is the height. I think making the cup placement area taller and more flate so cup isn't sitting odd. But, love it.

I was looking for a k-cup and loose leaf tea maker that was affordable. I've never heard of this brand but thought I'd give it a try and I'm glad I did. It works great. It makes cups of coffee and cider quick and its very hot. It's very easy to use.
Looks nice and works well. Love this little machine

I like two sizes of cups and it holds more than one cup off water and use tea ground and ground coffee great ideal

Looks expensive, brews fast and delivers same as my old keurig maker. Excellent machine. ( 50 oz water reservoir) have had for a few months and it’s the best coffee maker I’ve had. Only con is you need a smaller size cup.

This is my third single serve brewer and if it's possible to love a coffee maker, this is it.
It's quick,quiet,easy to use and with the accessories you can brew ground coffee loose tea. There's no drip after brewing. Holds plenty of water.

I got tired of pouring water into my single-cup coffee maker every time I wanted a fresh cup of coffee, and brewing a full pot on our drip coffee maker was a waste, but the full-size Keurig-style machines were just too much for my small countertop. This was just the perfect blend of size, convenience, and simple functionality. It brews a great-tasting cup of coffee in no time flat, and it's so simple to use. You have an "on" button and three buttons for the different cup sizes. That's it! Removing the tank to add water is easy and fast. You won't find a better machine for the price. I highly recommend it.
I like that it is small, and it is perfect for a small space

Very simple to use, great quality!!!
Small and compact. It’s smaller than the Kuerig I had that crapped out. It is sleek and holds as much water in its reservoir as a larger machine. Very pleased.
